intro: Boehmeria frondosa, commonly known as broadleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Boehmeria frondosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
